meanings.definition: Having a small hook or hook-shaped process.
meanings.sent1: The plant had hamulate leaves that helped it climb.
meanings.sent2: The hamulate design of the coat rack made it easy to hang hats.
meanings.sent3: The hamulate keychain got caught on everything, making it a nuisance.
meanings.sent4: Her hamulate earrings added a unique touch to her outfit.
meanings.sent5: The hamulate shape of the cloud resembled a tiny hook in the sky.

meanings.definition: To be equipped with a hook or hooks.
meanings.sent1: The fishing rod was hamulated with a sharp hook.
meanings.sent2: She needed to hamulate the curtains to keep them in place.
meanings.sent3: He tried to hamulate the rope to the tree branch but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: The pirate ship was hamulated with menacing black flags.
meanings.sent5: The chef would hamulate the meat with care to ensure it cooked evenly.

meanings.definition: A small hook or hook-shaped process.
meanings.sent1: The bird's beak had a tiny hamulate at the end.
meanings.sent2: She used a hamulate to hang her keys by the door.
meanings.sent3: The hamulate on the zipper made it easy to open and close.
meanings.sent4: The hamulate on the tool helped in picking up small objects.
meanings.sent5: The hamulate on the necklace clasp kept it securely fastened.
